intro: Eriocaulon walkeri, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in low-light conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
